1.text: At this also my heart trembleth, And is moved out of its place.

2.text: Hear attentively the noise of His voice, And the sound that goeth out of His mouth.

3.text: He sendeth it forth under the whole heaven, And His lightning unto the ends of the earth.

4.text: After it a voice roareth; He thundereth with the voice of His majesty; And He stayeth them not when His voice is heard.

5.text: God thundereth marvellously with His voice; Great things doeth He, which we cannot comprehend.

6.text: For He saith to the snow: ‘Fall thou on the earth’; Likewise to the shower of rain, and to the showers of His mighty rain.

7.text: He sealeth up the hand of every man, That all men whom He hath made may know it.

8.text: Then the beasts go into coverts, And remain in their dens.

9.text: Out of the Chamber cometh the storm; And cold out of the north.

10.text: By the breath of God ice is given, And the breadth of the waters is straitened.

11.text: Yea, He ladeth the thick cloud with moister, He spreadeth abroad the cloud of His lightning;

12.text: And they are turned round about by His guidance, That they may do whatsoever He commandeth them Upon the face of the habitable world:

13.text: Whether it be for correction, or for His earth, Or for mercy, that He cause it to come.

14.text: Hearken unto this, O Job; Stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.

15.text: Dost thou know how God enjoineth them, And causeth the lightning of His cloud to shine?

16.text: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, The wondrous works of Him who is perfect in knowledge?

17.text: Thou whose garments are warm, When the earth is still by reason of the south wind;

18.text: Canst thou with Him spread out the sky, Which is strong as a molten mirror?

19.text: Teach us what we shall say unto Him; For we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.

20.text: Shall it be told Him that I would speak? Or should a man wish that he were swallowed up?

21.text: And now men see not the light which is bright in the skies; But the wind passeth, and cleanseth them.

22.text: Out of the north cometh golden splendour, About God is terrible majesty.

23.text: The Almighty, whom we cannot find out, is excellent in power, Yet to judgment and plenteous justice He doeth no violence.

24.text: Men do therefore fear Him; He regardeth not any that are wise of heart.
